go_data.justification: Pof1p displayed ATPase activity, with catalytic efficiency comparable to other ATPases involved in endoplasmic reticulum-associated degradation of proteins (ERAD).
Pof1p is involved in the regulation of protein degradation, and its absence results in increased sensitivity to stress agents.
Pof1p interacts with Ubc7p, a component of the ERAD pathway, and is important in the unfolded protein response.
Pof1p shows a punctuated distribution in cells, similar to proteins localized in the Golgi compartment.
Deltapof1 cells are highly sensitive to oxidative stress agents, such as hydrogen peroxide and tert-butyl hydroperoxide.
Overexpression of POF1 suppresses the sensitivity of Deltapct1 strain to heat shock.
Pof1p interacts with Ubc7p, an ubiquitin conjugating enzyme, and may be involved in substrate recognition during ubiquitin marking.
